text: Making matters worse, everything we owned was in boxes in the garage, ready to be moved. The car wrecked an unholy amount of the family's possessions. Fortunately, my older sister who didn't have the sense not to let the younger drive, had the sense to yank the emergency brake.
author: Heminator

text: Just far enough out to get the requisite momentum, my sister stepped on the accelerator. Now it was a two car garage, and taking out a garage door would have been bad enough. She went right through the center post, taking out both doors.
author: Heminator

text: So my completely untrained (well, maybe she'd driven with gramps on his farm?) 11 year-old sister gets behind the wheel, while my older sister gives her careful instructions. She does great, slowly pulling into the driveway, perfectly centered. No one knows what happened next.
author: Heminator

text: I got into the backseat and my two sisters got into the front. Immediately, my two sisters start arguing. About what, you ask? WHETHER MY FIFTEEN YEAR-OLD SISTER SHOULD LET MY ELEVEN YEAR-OLD SISTER DRIVE. This went on for a while, and eventually, my older sister relented.
author: Heminator

text: So when one car left, my parents asked my oldest sister with the permit to pull the other car into the driveway so it could be loaded up for the next trip in the move. Now for reasons I don't recall, both myself and my younger sister followed the oldest to the car.
author: Heminator

text: Now, I had two much older sisters, that were seven and nearly 12 years older than I was. The oldest had a permit to drive, but not a license. We driving a lot of boxes from one house to the next with two cars, and I believe one had been blocking the driveway.
author: Heminator

text: This video reminds me of a story from my youth, so, ahem, buckle up. When I was about four, we were moving from one house to another in the same town. The houses were about a mile apart. We were doing most, if not all of the move ourselves.
author: Heminator
